entry.title: GRC Tuesdays: What Risks to Look Out for in 2026
entry.content:
In previous years, I used to release a blog ranking the top risks for the year to come – as per analysts, experts and business leaders insights, but this has proven quite impossible this year.

There are mainly 2 reasons for this:

  1. The great discrepancies in views in what the main business threats are – depending on the industry and region. When there was previously somewhat of a consensus on top risks, for 2026 onwards, the risk landscape seems be quite “fractured” with diverging opinions
  2. The risks are more and more interconnected. An impact on one category directly increases the likelihood of adverse events in another category from occurring

As a result, instead of playing Nostradamus, I decided to try and summarize this complexity without objectively granting more weight to one area over another.

 

10 business threats to look out for – in no particular order

 

Geopolitics

 

With the rise of nationalism and protectionism, the multilateral globalization that fostered international commerce for decades has ceased to exist. Not that global trade won’t continue of course, but the rules are being rewritten due to weakened governing institutions. Whereas trade agreements were previously the result of year long negotiations, this is no longer the case. And it questions their longevity. Will these quickly negotiated treaties continue to apply should administrations change or the legislator rule against their implementation?

This risk category and associated events directly impact Supply Chain and Economic Conditions, but also Security since (re-)militarization and conflicts are direct consequences of shifts in the geopolitical technical plaques.

 

Human Resources and Talent Management

 

Despite globalization of the labour market, talent shortage in in-demand sectors and functions is obvious. This is further heightened by inadequate skills in these areas.

Combined with economic uncertainty and reduction in workforce for some industries, a direct consequence is a much more competitive market for both employees – who must fight for limited number of roles, and for employers – where some roles are not filled due to lack of qualified applicants.

A perfect example here is Security – and especially cybersecurity, where it is estimated that 87% of organizations are experiencing a shortfall of security talent with 3,5 million unfilled jobs worldwide.

Going back to Geopolitics, new restrictions in visa allocations decided by governments further increases the velocity of this risk as it impedes the movement of workers to countries with higher demand.

 

Artificial Intelligence

 

One of the most recent and yet pervasive top risk category is Artificial Intelligence. The more AI develops, the more it offers business opportunities but also the more it opens the door to new risk types. Ranging from legal threats with IP infringement for instance where an AI model can make use of data without licensing or authorization, to economic with Digital Disruption completely reinventing a market and even rendering obsolete Business Models, it has since quickly increased for Security risk levels as well with autonomous AI-driven cyber-attacks in the digital world or even self-directed drones in the physical world. In this regard, the Science and Security Board of the Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists who contribute to setting the time on the Doomsday Clock summarize it better than I would: “The potential for this particular technology [AI] to constitute an existential threat on its own is highly speculative, but as succeeding generations of such models are released, the potential dangers, existential or otherwise, will increase.”

A key challenge to come will be providing trust and confidence in AI systems. This could come with the implementation of Compliance and Regulations frameworks such as AI governance structures that maintain human oversight while supporting the achievement of AI’s automation promises. Recent AI legislative acts around the global are already targeting this, and their effectiveness will be crucial in achieving this balance.

 

Digital Disruption

 

Fostered by AI but not only, Digital Disruption has clearly started with the emergence of new technologies and continues to be a top risk. In addition to bringing new technological landscapes that have their own challenges, organizations also face digital disruption due to changing consumer behaviour in the era of e-commerce and digital-first customer journeys.

This is not only redesigning organizations’ marketing approaches, but it’s also impacting sales, delivery, customer support… and much more! And in some extreme cases, completely redefining Business Models.

 

Security – Cyber and Physical

 

As already highlighted in the Geopolitics and Artificial Intelligence categories, there is no doubt that Security is a major concern for organizations. Physical security with conflict zones extending in geographical scope but also now entering the cyberspace and creating a new age of hybrid attacks where crippled infrastructure poses a vital threat.

It is therefore not surprising that the Global Peace Index has worsened and that the Doomsday Clock is inching towards midnight, with only 89 seconds to spare.

But increased security threats are also the result of in-house deficiencies. For instance, Cybersecurity experts highlight that the increase in unmonitored vulnerabilities leaving companies exposed can be attributed to unsanctioned AI usage.

 

Economic Conditions

 

Previous year’s trend on rising costs – especially energy and natural resources, seem to have stabilized but are still very fragile and a persistent concern for organizations. If the global consumer price index (CPI) shows a slight inflationary decrease in 2024 versus 2023, it remains above pre‑pandemic norms.

On the downside, continued tariff driven trade tensions will likely add pressure in 2026 and render pricing and sourcing strategies much more volatile due to an unpredictable economic environment and Geopolitical decisions.

 

Business Model

 

“Business resilience” and “Shift in consumer behaviour” are the most cited keywords in reports and interviews when it comes to root causes of evolving business models.

Consumer behaviour is not just about the way customers purchase a product or a service, it is also their spending pattern of course. With pointers indicating significant slowdown in recent months, mostly due to Economic Conditions and proactive cost reduction.  

For organizations that have focused on leveraging technology to fuel a new business model or overall preparedness, analyst feedback points out that the return on investment from Artificial Intelligence and Digital initiatives has been limited, often hindered by siloed data, misalignment with business needs or misguided decisions based on flawed AI outputs.

 

Compliance and Regulations

 

I have already addressed the impetus of Artificial Intelligence governance earlier and will address Sustainability reporting just below and it is undeniable that these 2 drivers will continue to spearhead new compliance requirements across the globe.

In addition, the mandate for companies to demonstrate continuous oversight of their IT systems and their incident response will remain very high, as requested by requirements such as the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA) and others.

As a matter of fact, associated data sovereignty directives will be increasingly strict and complex, driven by these new regulatory frameworks and heightened concerns about cross-border data flows, and cyber resilience. As a matter of fact, in this area alone, global regulations are escalating in response to growing Geopolitical tensions with over 135 countries having already implemented some form of data protection and sovereignty legislation.

 

Sustainability

 

If Sustainability initiatives have slowed down with many companies having reassessed or delayed investments and program deliveries, it can be traced back to more limited regulatory enforcement of legislation than planned, reduced global cooperation on climate change… and of course overall market uncertainty due to Economic Conditions.

That being said, there is an overwhelming consensus across all reports and interviews that sustainability and climate concerns continues to be a top risk. For companies and for the world. If escalating extreme weather conditions is driving higher insurance costs and operational disruptions, policy uncertainty around the low‑carbon transition and additional sustainability reporting rules in leading economic blocks are a reality.

It is no longer the case that companies use the green agenda as a reputation boost, but they truly must deliver on measurable sustainability performance gains and demonstrate exemplarity.

 

Supply Chain

 

Last but certainly not least in this list of top risks is Supply Chain. To me, it represents the most interconnected category. Any adverse event in another section will increase the likelihood of its own risks manifesting.

For instance:

  • Geopolitics: an increase in trade wars can lead to new sanctions, exports and/or imports hence, de facto, impacting supply and delivery capabilities.
  • Security: attacks – whether physical or cyber on suppliers, on operational sites, or IT systems can result in system shutdowns, once again preventing the company from procuring the necessary materials for producing and distributing its good and services.
  • Economic Conditions: with fluctuating prices and rapidly evolving consumer demands, forecasting and demand planning is becoming increasingly complex.
  • Compliance and Regulation: requirements such as the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive, the Digital Operational Resilience Act or even the EU AI Act extend transparency and accountability to the company’s third-party providers.
  • Sustainability: extreme weather events such a floods, droughts or hurricanes are causing more frequent and severe operational disruptions, damaging infrastructure, leading to port closures, and blocking key trade routes.

 

What else?

 

This is the question that most business leaders I interviewed answered once they had provided their views: what else did I miss?

Despite being somewhat on the horizon for the following year, at the end of 2024, tariffs were not ranked as the major concern for many organizations. That was until the US administration enforced new rules, and this completely flipped the risk landscape upside down in just a few days. From then on, at least 50% of my “risk conversations” revolved around this topic. At least for the first half of 2025.

So, I turn the question to you: is there another similar emerging risk that I haven’t captured in this summary that you think should feature? If so, feel free to add your suggestions in the comments section of this blog!

If you are interested in comparing this picture to previous years’ reports, then I have listed them below for your convenience:

  • GRC Tuesdays: What Risks to Look Out for in 2025
  • GRC Tuesdays: What Risks to Look Out for in 2024
  • GRC Tuesdays: What Risks to Look Out for in 2023

And if you are interested in learning more about SAP solutions for Governance, Risk, and Compliance, feel free to fill-in the demo request form!

entry.title: Step-By-Step Guide: Creating Your First RAP Application using OData V4 and Transporting to Quality
entry.content:
Introduction

In this blog, we will walk through the detailed steps to create your first RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) application and correctly move it to the Quality system. This blog also highlights mandatory steps before transport and common mistakes that beginners usually make, based on real project experience.

Target Audience & Prerequisites

  • ABAP developers who are new to RAP
  • Basic knowledge of CDS Views and ABAP Development Tools (ADT)
  • System used: SAP S/4HANA (On-Premise / Private Cloud)
  • Exposure type: OData V4
  • Scenario covered: Basic Read-only RAP application

    Mandatory Objects in a RAP Application:

    • Package
    • Interface CDS View
    • Projection CDS View (Optional we can directly create service definition on Interface view also)
    • Service Definition
    • Service Binding
  1. Create Package: 

    Create a package in ADT:

    • Right-click on project → New → ABAP Package
    • Enter package name and description
    • Do not create it as a local package ($TMP)
    • Capture it in a transport request     
    • Only transportable packages can be moved to Quality and Production systems.

    •  

  2. Interface CDS View: A CDS View is a virtual data model in ABAP that defines how data from database tables is accessed and represented. In RAP, it often serves as the “Interface View.”

    1. Why It Matters:

      • Reusable logic: Centralizes data access for transactional and analytical purposes.
      • Foundation: Serves as the starting point for business object modeling in RAP.

    2. Steps:

      • Right-click your database table (e.g., ZTRAVEL_RAJ_M), select New Data Definition.
      • Provide a name, description, and use the Define View Entity template.
      • Assign to transport, activate, and check for errors.

      •  

  3. Service Definition: The Service Definition specifies which data elements (entities) of a RAP business object are exposed as OData services.

    1. Why It Matters:

      • Exposure Layer: Decides what consumers (e.g., Fiori apps, external APIs) can interact with.
      • It’s the contract between your backend logic and external consumers.
                                                                                                         

    2. Steps:

      • Right-click on the projection view, select New Service Definition.
      • Name, description, assign transport, and activate.
      • This exposes your RAP objects as a service.

      •  

  4. Service Binding: Service Binding links a service definition to an actual communication protocol (such as OData V4) and activation state.
    1. Why It Matters:
      • Enables Consumption: Without binding, your service cannot be called or used.
      • Protocol Choice: Determines how front ends communicate with your service (e.g., OData V4 for Fiori/UI5 apps).

    2. Steps:

      • Right-click on the service definition, select New Service Binding.
      • Choose OData V4 protocol (for most Fiori/RAP apps).
      • Assign transport, describe, finish, and activate.

      •  

      •  

  5. Why You Should NOT Publish from ADT: Publishing directly from ADT is meant only for local testing.

    1. Issues with ADT Publishing

      • Service is registered as a local ($TMP) object
      • Cannot be transported to Quality or Production
      • Not supported for productive landscapes

    2. Correct Way: Publish via /IWFND/V4_ADMIN

      • Transaction /IWFND/V4_ADMIN is the recommended way to publish RAP services.

    3. Steps: 
      • Open /IWFND/V4_ADMIN and click Publish Service Groups

      •  

      • Enter System Alias = LOCAL, Service Binding name click on get service groups

      •  

      • Select service and Publish

      •  

      • From the service group list, right click on your service group and click on transport publishing. It will prompt for customizing TR enter the transport and save. After that Click on transport routing assignment and capture in the customizing TR.

      •  

      •  

      • Service is now published

      •  

  6. Preview: Finally, let’s preview the application to verify that the service is working as expected. 

    •  

Conclusion: 

  • In this blog, we learned how to create a basic RAP application and the correct approach to publish and transport OData V4 services to the Quality system.
  • Using /IWFND/V4_ADMIN ensures transport safety and helps avoid common deployment issues that beginners often face.

Note: 

To customize the user interface of your RAP application, add appropriate UI annotations in the CDS view (interface or projection, depending on your design). Common annotations include @ui.headerInfo, @ui.lineItem, and @ui.selectionField.

After publishing the service, share the service URL (available in the Service Binding) with the Fiori development team so they can create the required Fiori tile.
After transporting to the Quality system, SICF activation is a manual step. Without activating the relevant SICF nodes, the service will not be accessible. Coordinate with your Basis team to complete this step.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602 亮点前瞻
entry.content:
2026年的序幕已经拉开，SAP也在近期推出了崭新的SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602版本。帮助企业在这个不断演变的科技时代，寻求解决方案以达到执行与战略目标保持一致，还期待能够提升运营效率。那么，作为一名企业领导者，为什么应该考虑采用SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602来推动您的运营迈向未来呢？以下是我们 SAP Cloud ERP PSCC 团队为您解读的是该版本的一些亮点。您也可以参考Cloud ERP PSCC的负责人 @BeSchulze  发布的英文博客：My highlights of the SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release ，进一步了解SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602的具体内容。

AI：通过Joule与任务型智能代理将AI融入核心业务流程

在 2602 版本中，我们在持续深化嵌入式 AI 与 Joule 自然交互能力的同时，正式推出了新一代代理式 AI 功能（当前处于Beta发布阶段），致力于在复杂场景中实现多步骤任务的自主规划与执行。

会计应计智能代理（Beta版本)：

通过基于会计准则文件、历史数据和计算值建议应计项目，支持财务团队将工作重心从手动准备转变为集中复核。应计提案直接呈现在“管理应计提案”应用中，并附带清晰的推导解释，帮助总账会计在不失去过程控制的情况下，更有信心地过账应计项目。

Demo Digital Library - Asset Preview Page

生产计划与运营代理 (Beta版本)：

可在“管理生产订单”应用中通过“Joule 发布”按钮启动。该功能可一次性辅助发布多达 20 个订单。代理会自动执行物料可用性（含替代件检查）、工作中心产能及进度验证。若上述条件不满足，代理还会主动建议重新排程工作方案。

Demo Digital Library - Asset Preview Page

有关Beta发布的注册和更多信息，请关注Influence Opportunity Homepage - Customer Influence

关于如何在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中激活SAP Business AI功能，请参看以下SAP note：

3651017 - 在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 中激活 SAP Business AI 功能 - SAP for Me

更多有关AI创新的详细内容请参考 @Helen_Han 的博客。

供应链与质量管理能力提升

在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602中，供应链与质量管理的能力得到了显著提升。供应链管理方面，增强覆盖了物流跨主题、订单承诺、库存管理、库存分析与控制、以及仓库管理等。质量管理方面，则在质量计划、质量检验和质量改进等领域进行了系统性的优化与提升。如下面示例：

库存管理 – 预留

在最新版本更新中，预留操作流程得到了显著增强。用户现在可以通过 “管理预留项目” 应用，直接基于预留创建库存转储过账（移动类型 311），无需手动切换和重复录入。执行转储后，系统自动跳转至 “管理预留物料凭证” 应用进行过账，过账成功后自动生成两条物料凭证：一条发货，一条收货。

 这一增强优化了库存转储与预留管理的整合，减少操作步骤，提升工作效率，并增强业务流程的可追溯性。用户可以快速查看物料凭证详情，轻松获取详细信息，显著提升物料凭证管理的效率和数据可读性。

 

更多供应链管理和质量管理相关的详细内容请参考 @ecco_liu 的博客。

权限自由新体验：直接分配应用给业务角色

在之前的版本中，我们推出了IAM（身份与访问管理）应用程序这个概念，在权限设计上以应用而不是业务目录作为最小单元，给了权限分配极大的灵活性。但是，我们还是需要首先给业务角色分配相应的业务目录，然后在已分配的权限里做调整。

从2602这个版本开始，我们甚至可以直接给业务角色分配IAM应用程序，可以不需要分配业务目录。假设我设计了一个数据迁移的业务角色MIGRATION_USER，我给它分配了一个数据迁移的业务目录，你能看到它能访问数据迁移工具相关的应用，如下所示：

在IAM应用程序页签下，点击右上角的编辑按钮，你可以看到有一个“添加”按钮：

假设我需要我的这个角色的用户在导入数据之后，可以查看销售订单和采购订单的数据，以验证导入的数据是否正确。我可以点击添加按钮，查找相关的IAM应用并添加如下：

你能看到，我直接添加了“显示销售订单”和“显示采购订单”的权限，分配类型为“直接”，也就是我直接添加的权限，而不是通过业务目录分配而得。有了这种方式，对于我们需要配置非常个性化的业务角色将会更加方便。

更多跨技术话题相关的详细内容请参考 @Vincent_Zhu 的博客。

分析报表功能增强

最新S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 版本的发布，为分析带来了强大的功能增强，旨在提升可用性、简化工作流程并提供更深刻的业务洞察。这些新功能对于依赖及时准确数据来驱动业务发展的业务分析专家、财务相关业务人员以及决策者尤为重要。以下是这个版本的重要功能：

  • 新应用：日记账分录分析器（新版本）
  • 新应用： 我的注释
  • 视图浏览器增强
  • 审核手册增强
  • 多维分析增强
  • 【重要】CE2602 弃用的CDS 视图

例如上图为本次发布引入了全新的“我的注释”应用，作为管理协作反馈和讨论的集中枢纽，显著提升注释的可见性、可追溯性与处理效率。该应用会实时汇总您在启用注释功能的审核手册应用（Review Booklets）和多维分析（Multidimensional Analysis）应用中创建、复制或回复的注释，便于统一查看与管理。

更多分析报表相关的详细内容请参考 @AngelaDai 的博客。

可拓展性与开发者增强

在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602版本中，可拓展性又有了新的变化，在关键用户可拓展性、开发者可拓展性等都带来了新的增强。以下是这个版本的重要变化：

API增强：业务伙伴、成本率、客户退货、贷项凭证等API有变化和增强

BAdI增强：新增了催款通知的BAdI

自定义字段增强：在维护零售站点应用中，有多个新增自定义字段拓展

自定义业务对象APP更新了新的版本，包含如下几点功能：

  • 生成功能齐全且包含用户界面的 RAP（Restful Application Programming） 业务对象
  • 使用实体操作语言（EML）为业务对象添加行为
  • 在自定义业务对象之间创建关联以实现重用
  • 使用变更凭证跟踪自定义业务对象中的更改

更多可拓展性相关的详细内容请参考 @Zhehui_Xia28 的博客。

固定资产部分报废：支持基于购置年度来定义处理顺序

使用

在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602版本中，对于更改余额的资产交易，可以参考当前年度购置来区分，并参考上一年度购置来区分。某些交易只能针对当前年度的价值，也可以针对先前年度的价值。

例如，部分报废就是这种情况：如果资产具有来自不同会计年度的多个购置价值，则系统提供的新功能会在进行报废过账时提供考虑这些购置的可能性。这意味着，根据您是想要先报废较旧还是较新的资产余额，这样操作可能会产生不同的折旧金额。

具体的，可以使用“购置年度”选项定义处理顺序

您可以通过在参考部分中选择购置年度字段的选项来影响资产特定过账应用（例如过账资产报废应用）中的处理顺序。

更多财务相关的详细内容请参考 @BobShen 的博客。

寻源和采购

SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602当中寻源和采购版块发布的新功能以及重大变化和须知，将会覆盖以下话题内容：

  • 寻源和合同管理
  • 运营采购
  • 发票管理

采购申请抬头附件至采购订单的传输

本次版本更新后，你可在管理采购申请 - 专业版应用中，通过采购申请抬头层级的附件面板，将文档管理服务（DMS）作为外部文档（标识：SL1）添加至系统。该功能可实现采购申请抬头附件向采购订单的自动传输

 

更多寻源和采购相关的详细内容请参考 @kane_xin 的博客

销售功能增强

SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602当中销售版块发布的新功能以及重大变化和须知，将会覆盖以下话题内容：

  1. APP: 管理销售凭证
  2. 高级销售首付款申请
  3. 高级公司间销售-销售套件
  4. 组条件阶梯价应用
  5. 销售流程扩展性
  6. 销售凭证打印：输出渠道EXTOM
  7. 新增API配置点
  8. 开票偏离过账日期
  9. 经典公司间开票应付账款后台处理框架
  10. 客户退货无需退款流程

更多详细内容请参考 @Feng_Chen 的博客。

服务订单管理增强

在2602版本中，我们迎来了一个激动人心的更新——服务订单管理模块现在支持将间接费用项目直接分配到服务订单项目. 在过去，这些间接费用就像"隐形"一样，无法与服务订单建立直接关联。会遇到如下报错。但在新版本中，这一切都成为了历史。全新的间接费用分配功能，让你可以将这些"看不见"的成本精准地分摊到相应的服务订单项目中，真正实现项目全成本核算。

此次更新我们还首次将产品层次结构引入服务交易，您可以通过对服务中产品层次结构和客户层级结构的配置。更多详细内容可参考 @Qi_Liu 的博客。

📽️ 敬请期待我们的 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有版2026年大中华区Product Expert Training上半年度的产品专家培训系列！将在4-5月拉开序幕！

Greetings,

I think per standard this can be acheived only manually. If you would like to automate it then some development might be required.

You need to establish a link between maintenance activity type and task list. Classification class type 018 can be used for that. Below is an example based on your requirement. Classification class 018 is used to clasify task list header.

SPRO -> Plant Maintenance and Customer Service -> Maintenance and Service Processing -> Maintenance and Service Orders -> Functions and Settings for Order Types -> Maintenance Activity Type

entry.title: Shopify Admin Access Token Limits & Approach to Generate Offline Token via Developer Dashboard
entry.content:
Background
Shopify has introduced limitations on Admin API access tokens at the store level, and at the same time legacy custom apps are being deprecated (no new legacy apps after Jan 1, 2026).

For integrations such as SAP CPI / SAP BTP / SAP Commerce / SAP Concur, we often need a non-expiring (offline) Admin API access token for backend-to-backend communication.

This post explains a parallel and supported approach to generate an offline Admin API access token using the Shopify Developer Dashboard, instead of relying on store-level custom apps.

Why This Approach?

  • Avoids store-level admin token limitations
  • Works with offline access (non-expiring token)
  • Suitable for SAP integrations (CPI, BTP, ECC, S/4HANA, etc.)
  • Uses Shopify Dev Dashboard apps, not legacy custom apps

Step-by-Step: Generate Offline Admin API Access Token

1.Create App in Shopify Developer Dashboard

  1. Log in to the Shopify Developer Dashboard
  2. Create a new app
  3. Select the target store during app setup

2.Configure App Version & Scopes

  1. Navigate to Versions
  2. Create a new version (example: v0.1)
  3. Select all required Admin API Scopes (permissions)
  4. Copy the scopes into Notepad (you’ll need them later)

3.Enable Legacy Install Flow

This is important for offline token generation.

In the version settings:

Set “Use legacy install flow” = True

4.Set Redirect URL
Under Allowed redirection URL(s), add:

https://localhost/

5.Release the App Version
Click Release

This makes the version active and installable

6. Get Client Credentials
Go to Settings and copy:

Client ID

Client Secret

Generate Admin API Authorization Code
7. Construct Authorization URL
Replace the placeholders with your actual values:

https://{SHOP_NAME}.myshopify.com/admin/oauth/authorize?client_id={CLIENT_ID}&scope={SCOPES}&redirect_uri=https://localhost/&response_type=code


Notes:

{SHOP_NAME} → Shopify store name

{CLIENT_ID} → From Developer Dashboard

{SCOPES} → Paste all scopes copied earlier (comma-separated)


8. Install App & Capture Code
Open the constructed URL in a browser

Click Install

You’ll be redirected to a broken localhost page or redirected page (expected behavior)

In the browser address bar, copy the value after:

code=

Important:

Authorization code expires in 60 seconds

If the page doesn’t load:

Press Enter once

Immediately copy the full URL

Extract the code parameter


Exchange Code for Offline Admin Access Token
9. Call Shopify Token API (POST)
Endpoint:

https://{STORE_NAME}.myshopify.com/admin/oauth/access_token
Headers:

Content-Type: application/json


Body (JSON):

{
"client_id": "CLIENT_ID_FROM_DEV_DASHBOARD",
"client_secret": "CLIENT_SECRET_FROM_DEV_DASHBOARD",
"code": "CODE_FROM_BROWSER"
}
10. Result
Shopify returns an offline Admin API access token

  • Token does NOT expire
  • Can be safely stored and used in SAP integrations

Now you will have Access token where you can use it in header param (X-Shopify-Access-Token) and graphql API ( https://StoreName.myshopify.com/admin/api/2025-01/graphql.json) and graphql query 🙂

Key Takeaways

  • Shopify store-level admin tokens now have limitations
  • Legacy custom apps are being phased out
  • Developer Dashboard apps + legacy install flow provide a reliable workaround
  • This method is ideal for SAP CPI / SAP BTP / backend integrations
  • Offline Admin API token is permanent unless revoked

Also, no — you didn’t. This is not a clash of titans or a UFC fight, nor is this an attack against you.

The purpose of my blog series is to help junior, mid-level, and senior practitioners move beyond the narrow “SAP CPI developer” label and better understand the broader role of an SAP BTP Integration Consultant — including how to work across the SAP BTP integration portfolio, either holistically or selectively, depending on the scenario.

entry.content:

1.Onboarding module -respond Onboardee data models.

2.MPH- respond employee data models.

entry.title: Re: Unexpected Gap in Order Number Sequence
entry.content:
Hi

Gaps & jumps are normal and standard SAP behaviour. This is due to buffering method and buffer size as defined in SNUM and also depend on the number of application servers.  Kindly refer to SAPs excellent Guided Answers on this topic. 

Having said that, >8000 is a bit excessive. You need to analyze whether there is an underlying issue. For example, check ST22 for shortdumps that 'consumed' numbers and didn't roll back, check SM13 for 'hanging' update records etc.

entry.title: DRAFT HANDLING IN BOPF - Implementing Draft-enabled Sales Order Request
entry.content:
Introduction. 

Draft functionality is a widely used feature in SAP Fiori applications, enabling users to temporarily save changes without committing them to the active data .  

 In this blog, I will demonstrate how to enable draft functionality using BOPF (Business Object Processing Framework) for a custom Sales Order Request business object.  

The requirement is to build a Sales Order Request object with draft capability using BOPF. The key . 

Step 1: Activate the Persistence Table 

We begin by creating the active persistence table that stores finalized sales order requests. 

@EndUserText.label : 'Sales Order Request' 
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE 
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT 
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A 
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #RESTRICTED 
define table zmuk_dt_so_req { 
key client : mandt not null; 
key so_req_id : /bobf/conf_key not null; 
cust_id : zmuk_de_cust_id; 
mat_id : abap.char(10); 
quantity : abap.numc(10); 
req_date : abap.dats; 
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'zmuk_dt_so_req.currency' 
price : abap.curr(15,2); 
currency : abap.cuky; 
total_price : abap.numc(10); 
status : abap.char(15); 
created_by : syuname; 
created_on : abap.dats; 
}

Step 2: Generating the Draft Table Automatically 

When we use the draft enablement annotations in the CDS interface view, the system automatically generates the draft persistence table. 

In our case, we specify: 

@ObjectModel.writeDraftPersistence: 'ZMUK_DT_DRAFT_SO' 

Here is the auto-generated draft table:

@EndUserText.label : 'ZMUK_I_DRAFT_SO_REQ ZMUK_I_DRAFT_SO_REQ' 
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #EXTENSIBLE_ANY 
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT 
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A 
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #RESTRICTED 
define table zmuk_dt_draft_so { 
key mandt : mandt not null; 
key so_req_id : /bobf/conf_key not null; 
cust_id : zmuk_de_cust_id; 
mat_id : abap.char(10); 
quantity : abap.numc(10); 
req_date : abap.dats; 
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'zmuk_dt_draft_so.currency' 
price : abap.curr(15,2); 
currency : abap.cuky; 
total_price : abap.numc(10); 
status : abap.char(15); 
created_by : syuname; 
created_on : abap.dats; 
activeuuid : /bobf/uuid; 
hasactiveentity : sdraft_has_active; 
include sdraft_write_draft_admin; 
}

Additional fields are  added by the framework: 

These fields enable BOPF to manage the draft lifecycle automatically. 

Step 3 : Create a CDS interface view with Draft Handling 

We now define the CDS interface view, which links the active and draft persistence tables and enables draft functionality. 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED 
@EndUserText.label: 'Draft for sales order request' 
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true 
@ObjectModel.usageType:{ 
serviceQuality: #X, 
sizeCategory: #S, 
dataClass: #MIXED 
} 
@ObjectModel : { 
representativeKey: 'so_req_id', 
modelCategory: #BUSINESS_OBJECT,
semanticKey: [ 'so_req_id' ], 
transactionalProcessingEnabled: true,
compositionRoot: true, 
createEnabled: true, 
updateEnabled: true, 
deleteEnabled: true, 
draftEnabled: true, 
writeActivePersistence: 'ZMUK_DT_SO_REQ', 
writeDraftPersistence: 'ZMUK_DT_DRAFT_SO' 
} 
@OData.publish: true 
define view entity ZMUK_I_DRAFT_SO_REQ as select from zmuk_dt_so_req 
{ 
@UI.facet: [{  
type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE, 
position: 10, 
label: 'Sales Order Request', 
purpose: #STANDARD 
}] 
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'SO requets ID' }] 
@UI.identification: [{ position: 10, label: 'SO requets ID' }] 
key so_req_id, 
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Customer ID' }] 
@UI.identification: [{ position: 20, label: 'Customer ID' }]  
cust_id, 
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 30, label: 'Material ID' }] 
@UI.identification: [{ position: 30, label: 'Material ID' }]  
mat_id, 
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 40, label: 'Quatity' }] 
@UI.identification: [{ position: 40, label: 'Quatity' }]  
quantity, 
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 50, label: 'Request ID' }] 
@UI.identification: [{ position: 50, label: 'Request ID' }]  
req_date, 
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 60, label: 'Price' }] 
@UI.identification: [{ position: 60, label: 'Price' }]  
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'currency' 
price, 
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 70, label: 'Currency' }] 
@UI.identification: [{ position: 70, label: 'Currency' }]  
currency, 
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 80, label: 'Total Price' }] 
@UI.identification: [{ position: 80, label: 'Total Price' }]  
total_price, 
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 90, label: 'Status' }] 
@UI.identification: [{ position: 90, label: 'Status' }]  
status, 
created_by, 
created_on 
}

Note : 

  • draftEnabled: true activates draft handling in BOPF. 
  • writeActivePersistence → points to the active table (ZMUK_DT_SO_REQ). 
  • writeDraftPersistence → triggers automatic generation of the draft table (ZMUK_DT_DRAFT_SO). 
  • @odata.publish: true → exposes the CDS view as an OData service with draft actions. 

Step 4:  Creating OData Service 

Go to /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICES to add the service. 

Click on Add services to add the service. 

Provide the system alias name and technical service name, while adding the technical service it should be same as the CDS view which we have created above along with _CDS and then press enter. 

 Example: - ZMUK_I_DRAFT_SO_REQ_CDS 

The backend service will appear, now select the backend service and click on Add selected services 

Provide the package name and save it. 

It will ask to save it in the tr. 

It will display a successful message that the service was created. 

Now, go back and click on SAP GATEWAY CLIENT. 

Test the service in the Gateway client — you will notice the draft entity sets and actions (Edit, SaveDraft, Activate) are available. 

Now, go back and call the service in browser by clicking on CALL BROWSER. 

Copy the service name. 

Step 5 : Consume in Fiori Application 

To consume the service in a Fiori app: 

  1. Open VS Code with SAP Fiori tools installed. 
  1. Create a new Fiori Elements application. 

Select the list report and click on next. 

Select the data source as Odata service and add the odata service URL and provide the user name and password then click on next. 

Click on next again. 

Click on finish. 

Run the application. 

Existing records.

Create a record and don’t save it. 

Check for Own draft, the record is saved in the draft. 

If displayed with All records. 

Conclusion :

Draft Handling in BOPF ensures safe, consistent editing by separating draft data from active data. It improves user experience, prevents data loss, and enables smooth, interruption-free transactions.

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model What’s New as of 2026-01-19
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community.

Happy New Year and welcome to 2026! We’re excited to kick things off by highlighting the features released in late Q4 2025. Join me as I walk you through the newest features and improvements in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Universal Model (SAP PaPM Cloud UM).

To stay up to date with previous blog posts from my colleagues, you can always go through and read them all using this tag PaPMCloudUMWhatsNew .

With that, let’s begin.

Model

Model Transfer Structure

A new function type has been introduced to the Model Transfer Structure which offers the types:

  1. Transfer Structure 
  2. Reverse Transfer Structure 

It has the same functional capabilities as Transfer Structure, but the only difference is there is no need to Run the function since it is on-the-fly wherein Environment activation is enough.  

In Create dialog on Manage Functions application, the new function type Model Transfer Structure is displayed in Type field dropdown. 

In Model Transfer Structure configuration page, two types are displayed which are Transfer Structure and Reverse Transfer Structure in Type dropdown field under General Information section. 

In Universal Model Homepage, the new tile Manage Model Transfer Structures for the new function type is displayed under Model tab.  

For more information, please refer to Application Help for Universal Model Model Transfer Structure 

Currency and Unit Conversions

We’ve introduced a new enhancement across the Manage Currency Conversions, Manage Model Currency Conversions, Manage Unit Conversions, and Manage Model Unit Conversions applications to make configuration simpler and more user-friendly. With this update, the Target Value and Target Unit field/parameter value help now displays only the units mapped to the selected Conversion Input Function, instead of showing all units created in the environment.

This reduces confusion and makes it easier for users to quickly identify and maintain the correct fields needed for their conversion function setup.

Fields maintained in the Input Functions for both Currency Conversion and Model Currency Conversion. 

As shown below, the fields in the Target Value and Target Unit field/parameter display only the units mapped to the selected Currency Conversion Input Function.

This behavior is the same for Unit Conversion and Model Unit Conversion. Only the field mapped to the selected Conversion Input Function are displayed in the Target Value and Target Unit field/parameter.

Report

Manage Reports

Integrate Perplexity Web Search into Report Copilot

This feature allows you to use the Web Search tool to get up-to-date information directly from the web, making your reports more accurate, reliable, and informative.

SAP Joule serves as an AI copilot embedded in SAP applications, including report generation in tools like SAP PaPM Cloud UM, to deliver real-time insights grounded in business data. Integrating Perplexity's Sonar and Sonar Pro models as optional web search providers elevates this capability by enabling dynamic external data retrieval, superior citations, and contextual enrichment for workflows such as basic/advanced report generation, rewrites, section additions, highlighted updates, and general queries.

The enhancement adds Perplexity options in "Manage Connections" and "Manage Tenant Connections," including toggles for "Enable Web Search" (making model selection mandatory when active) and dropdowns for Sonar or Sonar Pro.

How It Works: 

The fields below become mandatory when you mark the Enable Web Search feature. You can select one of the following web search models for your report: 

  • “Sonar”: Select this option to perform real-time web searches and access a wide range of online information. 
  • “Sonar Pro”: Select this option for an advanced search and detailed analysis. This enhanced version of “Sonar” is designed for in-depth search and detailed insights. 

Highlight Changes in Report Versions: 

This is an additional feature for the Copilot that allows you to choose a specific section of text in the report and send a prompt to update it. It reviews the surrounding context to ensure that the changes fit naturally with the rest of the report. After the update, you can review the changes made: the system highlights what has been added or removed, and you can choose to accept or reject each change individually or apply all changes at once. 

"Report Copilot's New Tracked Changes: Green for Adds, Red for Removes – Your Workflow Just Got Better" 

Key Features: 

  • Visual Highlights: Added content shows with green underlines; deletions appear as red strikethroughs for instant recognition. 
  • Granular Controls: Accept or reject individual changes, or use bulk Accept All/Reject All buttons. 
  • Undo Integration: Undo reverts to prior states with accept/reject options intact, syncing seamlessly across features. 
  • Full Compatibility: Works with all Report Copilot actions, ensuring the final report reflects only accepted changes. 

How It Works: 

  • Make edits via write, rewrite, etc., and changes track automatically. 
  • Click per-change buttons or bulk options to accept/reject. 

  • View highlights inline in the editor. 
  • Hit undo to restore previous tracked state.​ 

  • Include screenshots of green/red highlights and buttons for visual appeal.

Show Screen

Show Screen: Column Label Sorting in Pivot Mode 

We’re making pivot mode more powerful and user-friendly! You can now sort data by fields assigned to Column Labels—just like you already do with Row Groups. 

Users working in Pivot Mode within the Show Screen can now apply sorting directly to Column Label fields using dedicated sort icons: 

  • Ascending 
  • Descending 

This works for any field placed under the Column Labels section. 

How It Works 

  • Click on a column name under Column Labels to apply sorting. 
  • Sorting behavior mimics Row Group sorting - data is reordered according to the selected “Sort by” field.

This enhancement gives users greater flexibility when analyzing pivoted data and improves consistency between Row Groups and Column Labels. 


That’s all for now!

We hope these new features and enhancements make your experience with Cloud UM even better. Stay tuned for more “What’s New” updates—published every month.

Share this blogpost with your colleagues and friends. Thank you!

entry.title: Re: Impact on RSH

Thanks for reaching out. Clear and short answer to your question: no, there will be no impact!
RSH is a separate solution that has no shared features, configuration, or even apps with MRS. Even if you were to delete MRS from the S/4HANA, RSH would still work. Markus

entry.title: Re: UoM changed in Va02 not reflecting in MB51
entry.content: MB51 is a report based on material documents which are stored in MSEG table. A material document is only created when there is a goods movement (e.g., goods issue, goods receipt, transfer posting). Changing the sales order unit of measure in VA02 does not trigger any goods movement → therefore, MSEG is not updated. That’s why MB51 still shows the original entry (in bottles) and does not reflect the later change to cases.  One more cross check what you can do is, check the latest delivery (not sale order) for that material and from the document flow, take the material document reference and pass it in MB51.  See which UoM is showing.

entry.title: Good to know: Analyzing Runtime Dump (SAP HANA Dump Analyzer vs Visual Studio Code)
entry.content:
• Why was this blog post created?
  • Where can I find the most important information about the SAP HANA Dump Analyzer and Visual Studio Code - Supportability tools for SAP HANA?
  • What are the experiences based on the comparison of the tools?
  • Generated report inSAP HANA Dump Analyzer
  • Generated report inVisual Studio Code - Supportability tools for SAP HANA
  • What is the conclusion?
  • Other articles
  • Do you have further questions?
  • Contribution

last updated: 2026-01-20

Why was this blog post created?

SAP HANA Dump Analyzer is a well-known and long-used tool. Same analysis can be done in Visual Studio Code - Supportability tools for SAP HANA (SAP Extension). It's worth getting acquainted with the new tool.

Where can I find the most important information about the SAP HANA Dump Analyzer and Visual Studio Code - Supportability tools for SAP HANA?

SAP Community Article: Where can I find knowledge and information belongs to SAP HANA?

  • section Runtime Dump (RTE)
  • section SAP HANA Dump Analyzer

SAP Community Article: Where can I find information about the available tools for SAP HANA (all types of use)?

  • section Visual Studio Code - Supportability tools for SAP HANA
  • section SAP HANA Dump Analyzer

What are the experiences based on the comparison of the tools?

The same analysis can be performed with both tools. The presentation is slightly different, with Visual Studio Code providing a fresher, more modern look, but the information in the reports is exactly the same. If Visual Studio Code is already installed, you can access a very useful analytical tool, with just adding the necessary SAP extension.

 SAP HANA Dump AnalyzerVisual Studio Code - Supportability tools for SAP HANA
DesignOld school.Modern.
Look and feelWell structured.Well structured but more compact.
What will be the generated result?.HTML fileResult will be opened in the application.
Can the various details and data be cut and copied?Yes.Yes.
Export.HTML fileN/A

Generated report in SAP HANA Dump Analyzer

The below example shows an outcome which generated via "Auto Analyzer" option. Other option is the "Expert Mode" - - > "Runtime Dump Mini Check". In some case there is a need to to generate both type of output for better understanding the issue.

Summary Info tab where system related information and detected issues presented.

In this example HANA Workload Analysis tab exists because this kind of issue has been identified.

Pie chart and highlighted statement hash gives us important information regarding the issue.

In this example Blocked Transactions tab exists because this kind of issue has been identified.

With Blocked Transaction wait Graph option we can get further details.

Generated report in Visual Studio Code - Supportability tools for SAP HANA

In Visual Studio Code we need to generate a work folder and import the files.

In this example High Workload tab exists because this kind of issue has been identified.

In this example Many Transactions Blocked tab exists because this kind of issue has been identified.

What is the conclusion?

Complete analysis can be performed using Visual Studio Code without installing the previously used SAP HANA Dump Analyzer. However, the old tool can be easily exported by saving it as a simple .html file, and with this action, the entire content can be stored offline and attached to an email, case, etc.

Other articles

✍️ Where can I find knowledge and information belongs to SAP HANA?
✍️ Where can I find information about the available tools for SAP HANA (all types of use)?

Do you have further questions?

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have question or observation regarding the article.
Q&A link for SAP HANA: https://answers.sap.com/tags/73554900100700000996 

Contribution

If you find any missing information belongs to the topic, please let me know. I am happy to add the new content. My intention is to maintain the content continuously to keep the info up-to-date.

Release Information

Release DateDescription
2026.01.20First/initial Release of the SAP Blog Post documentation (Technical Article).

entry.title: Artificial Intelligence in SAP Cloud ERP 2602
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public cloud ERP software solution.   

SAP Cloud ERP is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

In this blog, I’m thrilled to guide you through the latest AI innovations in our SAP Cloud ERP release 2602. This release marks a significant leap forward in our journey to embed reliable, relevant, and responsible AI directly into the core of your ERP. Our goal is simple: to make your work smarter, your decisions faster, and your daily tasks more intuitive.

With our AI co-pilot Joule and a host of new embedded AI capabilities, we're transforming the user experience and delivering tangible business value across every line of business. Let's dive into the highlights!

A Smarter Foundation: Cross-Topic AI Innovations

We're embedding AI into the very fabric of the user experience, making the system more proactive, helpful, and personalized for every user.

1. Situation handling

1.1. AI-assisted situation handling (release 2602.1)

Solve business challenges faster and smarter with AI-powered recommendations:

  • Instant, Personalized Guidance: Get tailored advice right when you need it, helping you resolve business issues quickly and confidently.
  • Flexible and Customizable: Adapt the solution to your unique business logic—make changes easily and keep your processes up to date.
  • Effortless Access to Knowledge: Find the information you need, even beyond SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, with simplified, contextual support.

Key Features:

  • Generate actionable recommendations based on your specific business context.
  • Create and manage prompts to ensure solutions are relevant and effective.
  • Enrich recommendations with data from multiple sources for deeper insights.

With AI-Assisted Situation Handling, you empower your team to work smarter, make better decisions, and stay agile in a fast-changing business environment.

For more information, see: Situation Handling

Discovery Center

 

2. User experience

2.1. AI-assisted error explanation for SAP Fiori elements-based Applications

With AI-assisted error explanations for SAP Fiori elements-based applications, you’ll save valuable time, boost reliability, and make maintenance easier than ever. Faster resolution of errors with the support of generative AI:

  • Speed Up Maintenance: Let generative AI quickly explain errors and recommend solutions, so you spend less time fixing issues and more time driving your business forward.
  • Reduce Future Errors: Understand the root causes behind problems, helping you prevent similar issues from happening again.

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

2.2. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications

Tailor My Home experience using natural language and transform your workspace with just a few words:

  • Natural Language Personalization: Simply tell SAP what you need—AI understands your requests and instantly suggests the most relevant apps for your daily tasks.
  • Quick and Easy Setup: Add new applications to your “My Home” in seconds. Preview AI-generated suggestions before confirming, so you always get what fits best.
  • Save Time, Boost Productivity: No more searching through menus. AI streamlines your workflow, making it ideal for both new and occasional users.
  • Trustworthy Recommendations: Rely on intelligent, data-driven suggestions that ensure accuracy and build confidence in your setup.
  • Seamless Experience: Enjoy a smooth, click-minimizing process with a preview-based confirmation—making personalization simple and enjoyable.

Unlock the full potential of SAP Cloud ERP by letting AI tailor your “My Home” to your needs—so you can focus on what matters most

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

2.3. AI-assisted easy fill of SAP Fiori elements-based applications

Let AI handle the details—just describe what you need, and watch your forms fill themselves:

  • Save Time Instantly: Maintain all the fields on your object pages in seconds, thanks to seamless AI-powered automation.
  • No More Guesswork: Simply use natural language, and the system intelligently matches your words to the right fields—no more hunting through forms.

With AI-assisted easy fill, you’ll breeze through data entry, reduce manual effort, and focus on what matters most in your business.

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

2.4. AI-assisted task automation (beta)

AI-assisted task automation is the next embedded AI feature in the SAP Fiori user experience of SAP Cloud ERP. It builds on the previously delivered features such as easy filter, easy fill and smart solutions for situations in My Home.​

It allows key users and end users to automate their daily activities in SAP’s Fiori apps by using generative AI to create so called “smart helpers”. Those ”smart helpers” execute the repetitive activities on behalf of the end user either from the SAP Fiori launchpad or from individual SAP Fiori apps while always keeping the user in the loop for decisions on data changes.​

Benefits:

  • Easy to use SAP Fiori application to create “smart helpers”​
  • Full control of what the “smart helper” proposes to do​
  • Intuitive way of running the “smart helper” while being always in control in case of changes​
  • Supports all SAP Fiori elements-based applications​

Key features:

  • Creation of “smart helpers” based on all available SAP Fiori elements-based applications in SAP Cloud ERP​
  • Generation and validation of execution plan for “smart helpers”​
  • Run time for “smart helpers” is integrated into My Home the product homepage of SAP Cloud ERP​

Please register to be part of the SAP Beta Testing of the Newest AI Innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

2.5. AI-assisted smart solution for situations (beta)

AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home simplifies workflows by dynamically adapting the user interface to guide business users through resolution steps using the power of generative AI

Directly on the SAP Cloud ERP homepage, users can resolve operational situations in just a few clicks. AI-driven recommendations accelerate decision-making and streamline user actions for improved efficiency

Benefits:

  • Drives time efficiency by eliminating navigation through intelligent UI design
  • Enhances decision-making with timely, context-aware AI recommendations
  • Delivers trustworthy AI-generated results, built on enterprise-grade intelligence
  • Offers an intuitive, click-efficient experience, empowering users to act confidently with minimal effort.

Key features:

  • Enables one-click resolution of situations directly from the homepage thereby enhancing operational efficiency within SAP Cloud ERP

AI Innovations Across Lines of Business:

3. Finance

3.1. Accounting Accruals agent (beta)

Close Your Books Faster with the AI-Powered Accounting Accruals Agent

The agent helps accountants to automate journal entry preparation for accruals by analyzing historical data and leveraging accounting policy documents. It calculates accurate amounts and provides a pre-populated list of journal entries for review and confirmation. Your accounts will increase their productivity, ensure timely month-end close, and get more time for high-value activities.

  • Automate Journal Entries: Let AI handle the heavy lifting by preparing accrual journal entries for you—twice as fast as before.
  • Boost Accuracy: The agent analyzes your historical data and accounting policies to calculate precise accrual amounts, reducing errors and manual work.
  • Ready-to-Review Entries: Receive a pre-populated list of journal entries, so your team can quickly review and confirm, saving valuable time.
  • Focus on What Matters: Free up your accountants to concentrate on high-value activities, ensuring a timely and efficient month-end close.

Business Impact:

  • Cut time spent on accrual calculations and deferrals by up to 80%
  • Reduce review and posting time by 50%
  • Achieve a faster, smoother period-end close

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

3.2. International trade classification agent (beta)

Classify your products for international shipping in seconds—no expertise required

This agent helps product classification specialists to classify goods for shipping. The agent reasons over product characteristics and trade regulations and acts to classify goods for international shipping. The agent recommends customs tariff numbers and commodity codes, providing rationale for easy review and approval.

This agent will help ensure compliance with global trade regulations and reduce the risk of manual errors with robust governance and a clear, audit-ready decision

  • Automatic Classification: Let AI analyze your product details and trade regulations to instantly recommend the right customs tariff numbers and commodity codes.
  • Ensure Compliance: Rely on recommendations that are reasoned from both product characteristics and up-to-date trade rules, helping you meet global regulations with confidence.
  • Reduce Risk: Eliminate manual errors with a robust, auditable decision process—every classification comes with clear rationale for easy review and approval.

Business Impact:

For more information, see: Discovery Center

The Product Profitability Review Booklet enables you, as a Sales Accountant, to analyze the profitability for products sold using built-in business pages for the Margin Overview and the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) Breakdown.

Have a question about SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity? Whether you’re curious about features, setup steps, or integration scenarios, Joule is here to help! With Joule, you can simply ask your question in natural language—no technical jargon needed. Joule instantly searches the SAP Help Portal, analyzes the latest resources, and delivers clear, context-aware answers tailored to your needs.

Key features:

For more information, see: Joule with SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity | SAP Help Portal

 

3.5. SAP Green Ledger: Joule for reporting: AI-assisted carbon emission analysis (09/2025)

Instantly Visualize and Understand Your Carbon Data with Joule in SAP Green Ledger

Joule in Green Ledger can generate charts from carbon data through conversational prompts, providing automatic visualizations for reporting purposes. This tool is useful for efficiently analyzing and presenting carbon data in a clear and intuitive format.

Benefits:

  • Actionable Insights for Sustainability: Instantly see trends and breakdowns in your greenhouse gas emissions, empowering you to make smarter decisions for carbon reduction and long-term success.

Key features:

  • Tailored Visualizations: Generate column, donut, and line charts from carbon data, customized to your business needs and reporting requirements.
  • Support for Multiple Dimensions: Analyze data by GHG category, GHG scope, fiscal year, and more, with carbon emissions as the primary measure.

For more information, see SAP Green Ledger, carbon emission analysis in SAP Discovery Center.

 

3.6. SAP Document and Reporting Compliance: AI-assisted trend analysis and summary for reports (beta)

The Trend Analysis feature in Joule provides natural language interaction to help you analyze VAT returns. You can ask Joule to generate comparative trend reports and detect outliers. Joule delivers insights that make VAT reporting faster, more accurate, and easier to understand.

Joule can also summarize the generated reports, helping you review key trends and results quickly. This makes it easier to identify anomalies and support faster approvals.

Benefits:

  • Accelerates VAT review and approval cycles: Natural-language trend analysis and auto-summarized insights reduce the time required to interpret VAT data across periods, enabling faster reviews, quicker approvals, and shorter reporting cycles.
  • Improves accuracy and reduces compliance risk: Automated detection of trends, fluctuations, and outliers helps identify anomalies early, minimizing manual errors and lowering the risk of incorrect filings or regulatory non-compliance.
  • Enables informed, data-driven decision-making: Clear, comparable trend reports and concise summaries transform complex VAT data into actionable insights, helping finance and compliance teams make confident decisions with less effort.

Key features:

  • Use Joule to generate a trend analysis for a VAT return across multiple reporting periods. The analysis highlights key trends, fluctuations, and irregularities, and flags values that deviate from expected norms to help you identify potential errors or compliance risks.
  • Joule generates a concise summary of key VAT insights to support faster reviews, approvals, and decision-making.

Internal sales representatives can create sales orders from purchase order files in PDF or image formats (unstructured data). After a file is uploaded, the system automatically extracts file information into a sales order request and proposes values for sales order request fields (for example, by determining the sold-to party based on extracted data). Benefits:

Key features:

Procurement

Asset Management

6.1. Maintenance notification creation and screening with Joule (release 2602)

SAP Cloud ERP 2602 makes asset management easier for everyone.

Now, you can quickly create maintenance notifications just by telling Joule—using simple, everyday language—what the issue is, which equipment it affects, and how urgent it is. All your notifications are managed in the new SAP Fiori app, where you can easily follow up and turn them into maintenance orders with just a few clicks. This update makes reporting problems faster, reduces downtime, and takes the hassle out of routine maintenance tasks.

Benefits:

  • Simplified Maintenance Processes: Create maintenance notifications quickly and easily using natural language, reducing the complexity of traditional workflows

  • Increased Efficiency: Streamline operations and boost productivity by leveraging AI-driven automation for routine asset management tasks.

 

Key features:

  • Natural Language Processing: Perform operations and interact with the system using everyday language, making the process faster and more accessible.

For more information, see: What’s new for Joule – SAP Help Portal

 

Manufacturing

7.1. AI-assisted production routing proposal and copy routing (release 2602)

Save time and reduce errors by letting AI do the heavy lifting! Now, you can quickly generate new production routings by reusing existing ones—no more repetitive data entry.

Benefits:

7.2. Manage production orders - Production Planning and Operations agent (beta)

With this feature, you can start the Production Planning and Operations agent from the worklist of the Manage Production Orders app. The app now includes the Joule Release button that enables you to release your production orders assisted by agentic AI technology.

Key features:

Discovery Center

 

Joule For Consultants

 

Clearer Source Citations

entry.title: Azure name and family name routing
entry.content:
Hi,

We have apps deployed to cloud foundy on a global account.
We have apps both in a space and in the HTML 5 repo.
We sometimes use a dedicated approuter and sometimes we deploy our own.

We have app users that connect using an Azure trust configuration in the subaccount.
We also have platform users using SAP's default IDP to login with an S-user.
This means that when a user wants to use an app or login to BTP cockpit he needs to choose which authentication to use,  SAP's default identity provider or the Azure connection.

I was asked to allow users to login without having to make this selection.
I setup and IAS trust configuration and inside the IAS I defined the Azure IDP and routing based on email hostname.
Now users are greated by the IAS login and when they input their azure email it redirects them to login using azure and when platform users use their email they login directly through IAS versus the users' creds I defined in the IAS.

The problem:
All our apps get data about the currently logged in user(to the app) via the approuter's /userinfo.
Now after setting up the IAS and the routing, if i log in as an Azure user i see in the devtools im not getting name and family name in the /userinfo any more, only email information.
I tried all orts of manipulations in the IAS but i cant see to get it to display name and family name like it does with a direct azure trust configuration.
Is there any IAS configuration solution to this issue or must we modify all our apps?

entry.title: How to Set Billing Condition Type PCIP to Use Fixed Currency (eg: USD) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Example scenario:

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, is it possible to set the billing document price condition PCIP with a fixed currency (USD)?

The finance team always uses USD as the calculation currency. When the billing document currency changes, discrepancies occur due to exchange rate conversion.

But in the billing document the document currency is EUR.
We would like the condition to be calculated in USD and then converted correctly to the billing/document currency.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to Set Billing Condition Type PCIP to Use Fixed C...
entry.content:
In the condition type PCIP, enable the Currency Conversion flag in configuration activity "Set Condition Types for Pricing in Sales"
With this setting:

  • The condition value is first calculated in the condition currency (USD).
  • Currency conversion is performed after the multiplication, based on the exchange rate.
  • The final condition amount is displayed in the billing (document) currency, while preserving USD as the calculation basis.

entry.title: Sourcing & Procurement in SAP Cloud ERP 2602
entry.content:
Sourcing & Procurement in SAP Cloud ERP 2602

Hello Everyone,

I am excited to share the latest innovations for Sourcing and Procurement from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 release. This update delivers significant advancements designed to enhance efficiency, intelligence, and integration across your procurement processes. With a strong focus on leveraging our AI copilot Joule, streamlining document flows, and providing more robust integration options, this release empowers procurement professionals to operate with greater speed and accuracy.

Purchase Order

  • Mass Update of Delivery date Using Joule

  • Transfer of header attachments from PRs to POs

  • Manually added delivery address

  • API for intercompany stock transfer

  • Mass creation of supplier confirmations in Joule

  • Purchase Order Output via External Output Management Systems

  • Receiver Roles : GS, CA, CP, ER in Purchase Order Output

  • AI-assisted Purchase Order Approvals Reminder

 

Purchase Requisition

  • Advanced purchase order scenarios with editable purchase orders

Central Procurement

  • Service level agreement categories in central processing of demands

  • Validation of overconsumption in central purchase contracts

  • Account assignment facet in a central purchase contract

  • Header and item notes in central supplier confirmations

 

What's new in Purchase Order

Mass Update of Delivery date Using Joule

With the 2602 release, Joule introduces a powerful mass update capability for Purchase Order items. When suppliers report delivery delays, users can now process these changes with unprecedented speed by using natural language commands. Joule interprets the user's instruction, identifies all relevant schedule lines across multiple items, and applies the necessary updates automatically. This reduces the manual effort of navigating through numerous line items, minimizes errors, and ensures purchase order data remains accurate and timely. Furthermore, users can monitor the background jobs initiated by Joule to maintain full visibility of the execution status and identify any potential issues promptly.

 

Transfer of header attachments from PRs to POs

To ensure a seamless document flow, header-level attachments are now automatically transferred from purchase requisitions to their corresponding purchase orders. This functionality supports complex scenarios, including the consolidation of multiple purchase requisition items into a single purchase order or the splitting of a requisition item into different orders. By referencing documents via unique DMS IDs, this feature establishes a single source of truth, eliminates the need for manual re-uploading of documents, and significantly reduces the risk of missing or inconsistent information in the procurement process.

Manually added delivery address

This release introduces the seamless transfer of manually added or modified delivery addresses from purchase requisitions to purchase orders within SAP Fiori applications. When a user enters a custom delivery address in a purchase requisition, that address is now automatically carried over during the conversion to a purchase order. This enhancement ensures consistent address handling across procurement documents, reduces errors stemming from manual data re-entry, and improves overall operational efficiency by guaranteeing the correct delivery address is used for procurement operations.

API for intercompany stock transfer

A new OData V4 API is now available to streamline the management of intercompany stock transfer orders (STOs). This modern, scalable interface enables external applications to create, read, update, and delete STOs synchronously, ensuring efficient and accurate management of stock movements across the organization. The API provides clear, transparent error messages for invalid data to improve troubleshooting and reliability. It also offers enhanced customization, allowing for the generation of user interfaces directly from the API to create tailored solutions for your business needs.

Mass creation of supplier confirmations in Joule

You can now accelerate the supplier confirmation process by using Joule to perform mass creation. Users can input up to ten purchase order numbers at once within the Joule interface to generate multiple supplier confirmations in a single, streamlined step. This capability eliminates the need to switch between different applications or screens, performing the entire process within one window. The system ensures that confirmations are only created for purchase orders that are eligible, reducing errors and simplifying the workflow for procurement teams.

Purchase Order Output via External Output Management Systems

This innovation provides the flexibility to send purchase order output to an external output management system. By connecting to SAP S/4HANA Cloud via the EXTOM channel, you can define your own output formats that match exact corporate branding, vendor-specific templates, or other key criteria. This capability allows you to select from multiple communication channels and build unique fallback and recovery mechanisms, giving you full control to design an output management strategy with your own rules for determination and generation that perfectly fits your business requirements.

Receiver Roles : GS, CA, CP, ER in Purchase Order Output

In this beta feature, purchase order output can now be sent to multiple receiver roles simultaneously, including Goods Supplier (GS), Contract Address (CA), Contact Person (CP), and Employee Responsible (ER). This enhancement improves communication efficiency by automatically routing purchase orders to all relevant internal and external stakeholders, eliminating manual distribution efforts. By providing immediate notifications to suppliers and internal teams, it reduces processing time and minimizes errors associated with missing recipients, thereby increasing operational transparency. Please note that as a beta feature, this is available for testing purposes only.

AI-assisted Purchase Order Approvals Reminder

Leveraging the power of conversational AI, Joule can now help you dramatically reduce purchase order approval cycle times. This beta feature allows you to use natural language to quickly identify purchase orders that are awaiting approval. You can ask Joule to show pending approver names and contact details, generate a reminder message, and send it directly via an integrated communication medium. This process, which takes only a few clicks, eliminates manual searching and follow-ups, enhances policy compliance, and mitigates delays in communicating orders to suppliers. As this is a beta feature, it is provided for testing and evaluation.

What's new in Purchase Requisition

Advanced purchase order scenarios with editable purchase orders

Efficiency is boosted for purchasers with the extension of advanced purchase order scenarios within the "Process Purchase Requisitions" SAP Fiori app. When the system simulates a purchase order creation and identifies an advanced process, such as a stock transfer order, it now navigates the user to the advanced "ME21n" app in the SAP GUI interface. The data from the purchase requisition is automatically populated, and the user can make additional adjustments and review any warning messages before the final save, streamlining the handling of complex scenarios without needing to start in classic transactions.

What's new in Central Procurement

Service level agreement categories in central processing of demands

Within Central Procurement, you can now configure and assign Service Level Agreement (SLA) categories to prioritize purchase requisitions. This feature allows you to define various categories, such as "High" or "Low," with associated processing times. You can implement custom logic to determine the appropriate SLA category for a demand, for example, assigning a "High" priority to requisitions from maintenance orders. The central purchaser cockpit will display the respective SLA category and remaining processing time for each requisition, helping to manage workload more effectively.

Validation of overconsumption in central purchase contracts

To provide more granular control over spend, this release introduces a validation check for overconsumption in central purchase contracts. The system will now automatically validate that any reduction in the target value or quantity of a central contract does not lead to an unintentional overconsumption of a distributed outline agreement that has already accumulated call-offs. Configuration options are available to issue either a warning or an error message when overconsumption is detected, allowing for closer tracking, especially for contracts without flexible distribution.

Account assignment facet in a central purchase contract

This feature simplifies work by allowing users to maintain backend-specific account assignment details directly on the distribution level of a central purchase contract. This information can be validated online against the connected system and is included in the follow-on distribution of the contract. By centralizing account assignment information within the central contract itself, this enhancement eliminates the need to navigate to the connected system to add accounting data after the initial distribution.

Header and item notes in central supplier confirmations

To ensure critical information from suppliers is captured accurately, header and item notes are now supported in central supplier confirmations. Using the "Manage Central Supplier Confirmations" SAP Fiori app, users can manually create, edit, or delete notes at both the header and item level. Additionally, these notes can be received electronically through the corresponding XML-based inbound interface and are subsequently copied into the corresponding purchase order, ensuring complete information flow.

entry.title: Notepad++ - is there ABAP-Syntax available ?
entry.content:
I know many people like Notepad++,  I sure do!

I noticed in the default installation of Notepad++ the ABAP-Language is unknown:

But there surely is an AddOn or something, right?

Ressources, after a quick search "notepad++ abap" :
https://community.sap.com/t5/additional-blog-posts-by-members/abap-syntax-highlighting-in-notepad/ba-p/13066249
https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/abap-syntax-highlighter-and-code-folding-in-notepad/ba-p/13344198
https://gist.github.com/jeremypage/6024925

 

Well, Notepad++ already shows the way:
User Defined Languages (UDL) explained:
https://github.com/notepad-plus-plus/userDefinedLanguages?tab=readme-ov-file
and here is the UDL list:
https://github.com/notepad-plus-plus/userDefinedLanguages/blob/master/udl-list.md
...and it has not one, but two ABAP definitions:

ABAP (by Christan Kosasih in 2012) :
https://github.com/notepad-plus-plus/userDefinedLanguages/blob/master/UDLs/ABAP_by_ChristianKosasih.xml
and
ABAP (by MithunKumar in 2021)
https://github.com/notepad-plus-plus/userDefinedLanguages/blob/master/UDLs/ABAP_by_ChristianKosasih.xml

entry.title: SAP CAP + PostgreSQL - how to remove field from schema without dropping table
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working with SAP CAP (Node.js) with PostgreSQL and I have a question about schema evolution.

I removed a field from my CDS model, for example:

 
 
entity Orders { 
 key ID : UUID; 
 name : String; 
 // oldField : String; // removed 
}After removing the field and redeploying, CAP does not drop the column from the existing PostgreSQL table.I tried different schema_evolution settings:

  • When I use:

     
    "cds": { "requires": { "db": { "kind": "postgres", "schema_evolution": false } } }

    CAP drops and recreates the table automatically, which is not acceptable for productive systems.

  • When I use:

     

               "schema_evolution": "auto"

    deployment fails with an error saying that dropping a field/column is not possible.

     

    In productive systems I want to avoid dropping and recreating tables, but still keep the schema in sync with CDS.

    What is the best practice for handling column removal/changing types of column etc in CAP with PostgreSQL?

    Thanks in advance for any guidance

entry.title: Re: Receive linked Projects with Master Projects via API...
entry.content:
Hello Namrata,

Thank you for your query. It appears your question relates to "master projects" and their associated projects. Please note that in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the master project concept is not available. Instead, S/4HANA offers applications for Professional Services with two project types: Customer Projects and Internal Projects.

Could you please confirm if your question relates specifically to S/4HANA Cloud? Additionally, please provide details regarding the APIs you are currently using.

Regards

Harish Gour
